metadata.title: The War at Home
metadata.time_reference: Immediately following Bartlet's State of the Union Address

notes: The episode deals with themes of leadership and the consequences of decisions made during a crisis.
The quote at the beginning is attributed to Clement Freud.

real_world_cultural_references: References to political events and military crises

continuity_notes: Follows directly after the previous episode which featured Bartlet's State of the Union address.

plot.plot_summary: After Bartlet's State of the Union speech, he authorizes a military rescue of U.S. drug agents held hostage by Colombian terrorists, but complications arise when the rescue mission faces unexpected challenges. Josh grapples with poll reactions to the speech while Toby confronts a discontented Senator.
